recentChanges: You can now add products to Spoonful without leaving the app! Just take a photo of the product name and ingredient list, and we'll send you an email once the product has been added. Thanks to everyone for helping us create this feature!
comments: This app gets used multiple times a day. I'm still new enough at Low FODMAP that I need to check everything. What I really like: You just scan the barcode and the info pops up. You can just glance and see "red" and know or, you can look at the reasons why and see the ingredients causing the FODMAP issue. This makes the app essentially educational. You learn what to look for to avoid issues. Also, if you were to eat something and have a reaction, you could check it to see what the offending ingredient was and know for next time. I also like that you can submit any product that is not yet there (I mean, there's a lot of products out there!) and the developer gets back to you by email to let you know that he added it. Nice!

Love this app! In the short time I have been using it, I have been able to scan and then avoid a number of IBS triggers that I never would have suspected were high fodmap, which has saved me a lot of future discomfort from extreme bloating. Highly recommend for anyone on the low fodmap diet due to IBS. An invaluable tool!

This app is very helpful for IBS sufferers on Low Fodmap diet, especially on the elimination phase. It can identify trigger ingredients and save you from buying something that can cause you issues. Looking at what others have scanned can also be very useful way to discover what low fodmap options are out there. They also have a facebook page where you can ask questions and offer suggestions. After Monash University App, this is the app I use the most for my low fodmap diet. Thanks guys!

So far, out of the FODMAP apps I've looked at, there are several things this app has that I really like. I didn't delve into the others very far, simply because of what I saw when the apps open. So far, this is the only app I've found with a scanner, that is amazing! You can scan a product, see what ingredients are in the "moderation" or "bad" category and decide if it's good for you or not. Also, the products are reviewed by medical professionals, big plus!

This app has helped me tremendously to navigate the High Fodmap content of gluten free products that I need to look for being Celiac. As soon as it came out, I scanned many GF products that I had in my cupboard only to find out that more than half of them were High Fodmap. Now when I do my grocery shopping and see interesting GF products, I scan them at the store and save myself a lot of headaches. Keep up the good work. From Ottawa, CANADA

title: Natural Remedies for IBS
description:
Natural Remedies for IBS | Irritable bowel syndrome Home Remedies

The symptoms of irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) are uncomfortable and potentially embarrassing. Cramping, bloating, gas, and diarrhea are never fun. Yet there are several lifestyle changes and home remedies that you can try to provide some relief. Although everyone‚Äôs body is different, once you find remedies that work, you can try using them to prevent discomfort.

At times, it can be challenging to get your irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) under control. You may find it helpful to learn about some herbs and other natural remedies thought to be good for digestive symptoms.

As compared with prescription medication, herbal remedies offer the potential benefits of fewer side effects and concerns about the safety of long-term use. However, prescription medications have to undergo rigorous safety testing before being made available to the general public. This offers research-documented information regarding safety and effectiveness, something that is sorely lacking for most herbal remedies.

Download this app for Irritable bowel syndrome Home Remedies

title: Plop - poop tracker & analyzer
description:
ÔºäEasy to record color, shape and/or symptoms
ÔºäInstantly analyze your data 
ÔºäInsightful stats and trends to navigate your health

TRACK DAILY PROGRESS
You track your steps and heart rate; you track your calories and weight; you track your cycle and mood; why not track your droppings? You can learn a lot about your body's health by observing your stool.

DELIVER PERSONALIZED SUGGESTION
Doctors regularly ask for stool and urine samples as part of the diagnostic process. Your stool can reveal signs of infection, digestive issues or more serious health problems. Pay attention to what is going on with your body.

GENERATE TRENDS OVER TIME
Your waste is what can tell you the most about your health. Keep a log of your logs for your health; it's a dirty job, but someone's gotta do it!

Your intestines contain a rich ecosystem of germs, bacteria, and cells that promote a healthy immunity system. Taking care of your intestinal health is taking care of your overall health! Track your intestinal health with the Plop app, and get a health heads up thanks to your bottom.

Disclaimer:
Plop is not intended to self-diagnose, self-treat, self-alleviate or to exclusively compensate for any disease or disability. If you have any concern, please consult with your doctor, or other qualified healthcare professional before using this App. However, you are welcome to use this app, for self-tracking, or as a reference to support your visit to a doctor or other qualified healthcare professional. Use this App at your own risk. The creators don't take any responsibility for direct or indirect damage that could result from its use.

title: Crohns Disease
description:
If you‚Äôve been diagnosed with Crohn‚Äôs Disease (or even you‚Äôve had Crohn‚Äôs for some time) you may be feeling uncertain about what it is and the potential impact it may have on your life.

This disease has related with many terms: what is Crohn's disease,Colitis,Crohn's disease symptomps,Crohn's disease diet,Crohn's disease treatments,symptoms of crohn's,crohn,symptoms of crohn's,... 

Crohn's disease is a type of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) that may affect any part of the gastrointestinal tract from mouth to anus. Signs and symptoms often include abdominal pain, diarrhea (which may be bloody if inflammation is severe), fever, and weight loss. Other complications may occur outside the gastrointestinal tract and include anemia, skin rashes, arthritis, inflammation of the eye, and tiredness. The skin rashes may be due to infections as well as pyoderma gangrenosum or erythema nodosum.

title: Low Fodmap Foods
description:
Food is a common trigger of digestive symptoms. Interestingly, restricting certain foods can dramatically improve these symptoms in sensitive people.

In particular, a diet low in fermentable carbs known as FODMAPS is clinically recommended for the management of irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).

This app explains what a low-FODMAP diet is, how it works and what foods are low fodmap.

A low-FODMAP diet is more complex than you may think and involves three stages.

Stage 1: Restriction
This stage involves strict avoidance of all high-FODMAP foods. If you're not sure which foods are high in FODMAPs, read this article.

People who follow this diet often think they should avoid all FODMAPs long-term, but this stage should only last about 3‚Äì8 weeks. This is because it's important to include FODMAPs in the diet for gut health.

Some people notice an improvement in symptoms in the first week, while others take the full eight weeks. Once you have adequate relief of your digestive symptoms, you can progress to the second stage.

If by eight weeks your gut symptoms have not resolved, refer to the What If Your Symptoms Don't Improve? chapter below.

Stage 2: Reintroduction
This stage involves systematically reintroducing high-FODMAP foods.

The purpose of this is twofold:

To identify which types of FODMAPs you tolerate. Few people are sensitive to all of them.
To establish the amount of FODMAPs you can tolerate. This is known as your "threshold level."
In this step, you test specific foods one by one for three days each (1Trusted Source).

It is recommended that you undertake this step with a trained dietitian who can guide you through the appropriate foods. Alternatively, this app can help you identify which foods to reintroduce.

It is worth noting that you need to continue a low-FODMAP diet throughout this stage. This means even if you can tolerate a certain high-FODMAP food, you must continue to restrict it until stage 3.

It is also important to remember that, unlike people with most food allergies, people with IBS can tolerate small amounts of FODMAPs.

Lastly, although digestive symptoms can be debilitating, they will not cause long-term damage to your body.

Stage 3: Personalization
This stage is also known as the "modified low-FODMAP diet." In other words, you still restrict some FODMAPs. However, the amount and type are tailored to your personal tolerance, identified in stage 2.

It is important to progress to this final stage in order to increase diet variety and flexibility.

Food is a common trigger of digestive symptoms. Interestingly, restricting certain foods can dramatically improve these symptoms in sensitive people.

In particular, a diet low in fermentable carbs known as FODMAPS is clinically recommended for the management of irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).

This app explains what a low-FODMAP diet is, how it works and what foods are low fodmap.

A low-FODMAP diet is more complex than you may think and involves three stages.

Stage 1: Restriction
This stage involves strict avoidance of all high-FODMAP foods. If you're not sure which foods are high in FODMAPs, read this article.

People who follow this diet often think they should avoid all FODMAPs long-term, but this stage should only last about 3‚Äì8 weeks. This is because it's important to include FODMAPs in the diet for gut health.

Some people notice an improvement in symptoms in the first week, while others take the full eight weeks. Once you have adequate relief of your digestive symptoms, you can progress to the second stage.

If by eight weeks your gut symptoms have not resolved, refer to the What If Your Symptoms Don't Improve? chapter below.

Stage 2: Reintroduction
This stage involves systematically reintroducing high-FODMAP foods.

The purpose of this is twofold:

To identify which types of FODMAPs you tolerate. Few people are sensitive to all of them.
To establish the amount of FODMAPs you can tolerate. This is known as your "threshold level."
In this step, you test specific foods one by one for three days each (1Trusted Source).

It is recommended that you undertake this step with a trained dietitian who can guide you through the appropriate foods. Alternatively, this app can help you identify which foods to reintroduce.

It is worth noting that you need to continue a low-FODMAP diet throughout this stage. This means even if you can tolerate a certain high-FODMAP food, you must continue to restrict it until stage 3.

It is also important to remember that, unlike people with most food allergies, people with IBS can tolerate small amounts of FODMAPs.

Lastly, although digestive symptoms can be debilitating, they will not cause long-term damage to your body.

Stage 3: Personalization
This stage is also known as the "modified low-FODMAP diet." In other words, you still restrict some FODMAPs. However, the amount and type are tailored to your personal tolerance, identified in stage 2.

It is important to progress to this final stage in order to increase diet variety and flexibility.

title: Inflammatory Bowel Disease
description:
Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) App - helps in understanding the disease condition through ANIMATED VIDEOS. This animation explains the process of digestion, and focuses on the causes including immune reactions, symptoms, complications, risk factors, diagnosis, treatment and self-help for the disease.

Editor: J.J. Misiewicz, Department of Gastroenterology, Central Middlesex Hospital, London, UK

App features
‚Ä¢	Pay once and download videos at your ease!
‚Ä¢	View downloaded videos without internet

Additional features include:
-	Drawing on the video for explanations
-	Capture images with mailing option
-	Option to make user notes and save
-	Transcript with links for additional references 

DISCLAIMER: The information provided through these applications are only intended to be informative and should not be construed as a substitute for medical advice.

title: GoHere: Washroom Locator
description: Need to find a washroom fast? GoHere is a free app which helps you find washrooms in the GoHere Initiative‚Äôs participating businesses and government buildings closest to you, or along the route to your destination. You may also use the Washroom Access Card to quickly explain your medical need. This app is designed to help users with incontinence issues, in particular those with Crohn's disease or ulcerative colitis - the two main forms of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD). GoHere is provided courtesy of Crohn's and Colitis Canada. Visit us at www.go-here.ca and www.crohnsandcolitis.ca for more information.

recentChanges: Minor bug fixes.
comments: This app supports one rigid model of locating restrooms. If you don't use location because you want privacy, it is useless. You cannot, for instance, view all restrooms in Calgary, you must instead request directions to Calgary from Calgary. If you get details on a restroom in Calgary, and try to return to the overview, no luck: back to the default view of Toronto. It is a good idea but a useless implementation unless your use case exactly matches the designers'.
I'd like to have the ability to add washrooms to this app for others. I'm in Northern Ontario many many kilometers away from Toronto.
only good for people in Toronto. rest of ontario not so much. should make it so people can add washrooms that they know of.
Thanks, super useful. Is this open sourced by any chance?
was next to like 3 bathrooms and it said there wasnt any near me ....

title: BelongIBD - Crohn's & Colitis
description:
The BelongIBD app provides people with Crohn‚Äôs & Colitis and their families a unique and innovative personalized solution to help manage and improve their quality of life.

Using BelongIBD, you will find support and professional groups for people living with Crohn‚Äôs & Colitis.

The FREE service includes:

- Access to leading medical professionals who answer your questions, including gastroenterologist, surgeon, nutrition and more‚Ä¶ 

- Assistance, tips, and support from a vast social network of others living with IBD.

- The ability to organize and manage your records on your mobile device, and share

easily with family and medical professionals.

- The ability to personalize information and notifications.  

- Access to a robust clinical trial matching service specific to your type of IBD.

BelongIBD is an information-sharing platform between users, healthcare stakeholders and
publicly available information. BelongIBD does not recommend, provide, suggest or deliver
advice of any kind.

title: Gut Health Storylines
description:
Now it‚Äôs easy to record your symptoms, food reactions, bowel patterns, moods, and more for Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis (UC), or other inflammatory bowel diseases (IBD). Choose what you want to track to build your own health story. This enables you to learn more about your health, and share more with your doctor, so you both see the full story.


With Gut Health Storylines, all you have to do is tap an icon, swipe a screen, fill in the blanks. 

Use the health tools on the app to better manage and monitor your Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis (UC), and other inflammatory bowel diseases (IBD):

‚Ä¢ TRACK symptoms, moods, and vitals signs related to your overall health

‚Ä¢ RECORD the foods you eat and any reactions triggered

‚Ä¢ MONITOR your bowel patterns to understand your Crohn's or UC flares

‚Ä¢ REMEMBER doctor's appointments and to take medications on time

‚Ä¢ JOURNAL about your condition and other aspects of daily living

‚Ä¢ IMPORT data from other health and fitness apps that you use

‚Ä¢ CONNECT with your circle of support, share your health story, and receive messages of encouragement

Disclaimer: App only contains medication database for US and Canada at this time. Other countries medication databases coming soon.

recentChanges: Further reduced data usage of the app
comments: Very Internet  dependant and missing most of the data I enter without an option to go back enter past data. Needs serious update dropping to 2 stars.

So at first I really liked the app. The tracking was easy, the graphs were helpful, and I liked that I could add my own symptoms to focus on what my specific issues were. But I ran into two deal killers for me.  1) you can't retroactively add bowel movements. Which is annoying because sometimes it's inconvenient to track it in the moment. Which leads to issue #2 2) I had a hard time accessing the tracking portion if I didn't have good cell reception. Bathrooms don't always have the best cell service so why I couldn't just track offline is beyond me. This wouldn't be a big problem if I could just log it later, but you can't.  It's a good app just didnt fit my desired style of use.

title: Low fodmap Diet - 30 days meal Plan
description:
I have created this app to help all peaple suffering from IBS to easely find ideas about what to eat every day on a low fodmap diet. it contains 90 + easy and affordable detailed recipes.

Low fodmap diet 30 days meal plan is very easy to use, after installation it can be used offline. you will be then able to follow a low fodmap diet for 30 days without any other researchs. 

If you have IBS and are following the low FODMAP diet to improve your digestive health by avoiding trigger foods then this app is for you . you will find a list of foods to avoid.

Note: this diet may be difficult to follow, and it is advisable to contact your health care professional or a dietitian to make sure that you are on the right track and getting enough dietary nutrients that you can consume.

Some infos you have to have : 

FODMAP stands for Fermentable Oligosaccharides, Disaccharides, Monosaccharides, and Polyols, which are short chain carbohydrates and sugar alcohols that are poorly absorbed by the body, resulting in abdominal pain and bloating.
FODMAPs occur in some foods naturally or as additives.
If you eat a lot of these foods you may have symptoms and signs like:
Gas
Pain
Bloating
Abdominal distention
Abdominal pain
Diarrhea
A list of examples of certain foods and drinks to avoid on a low FODMAP diet are some vegetables and fruits, beans, lentils, wheat, dairy products with lactose, high fructose corn syrup, and artificial sweeteners.
A list of examples of foods and drinks to eat on a this diet are certain vegetables and fruits, lactose free dairy, hard cheeses, meat, fish, chicken, eggs, soy, rice, oats, quinoa, non-dairy milks, and small servings of nuts and seeds.
This diet cuts out many common foods that may contain high FODMAP foods. They are eliminated or severely limited for 3-8 weeks, then gradually reintroduced into a low-FODMAP diet to see if they cause symptoms (elimination diet). It is not meant to be a permanent solution because it is very restrictive, but it may work well enough to be a treatment for people with gastrointestinal (GI) problems.
This type of dietary meal plan often is used to help with digestive symptoms from many different conditions, including, irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), small intestinal bacterial overgrowth (SIBO), and other functional GI disorders.

They are eliminated or severely limited for 3-8 weeks, then gradually reintroduced into a low-FODMAP diet to see if they cause symptoms (elimination diet). This type of dietary meal plan often is used to help with digestive symptoms from many different conditions, including, irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), small intestinal bacterial overgrowth (SIBO), and other functional GI disorders.
summary: delicious low fodmap Breakfast, lunch and dinner for 30 days to fight IBS
comments: Low foodmap Diet - 30 days meal Plan; very great app, I really appreciate and like this app. highly recommend this :)
They use all the (common) meats. Chicken, cow, pig.

title: LOW FODMAP DIET FOR BEGINNERS
description:
Do you experience biological process stress virtually each single day?
Does it cause you to feel not solely physically tired, thus showing emotion exhausted too?
If you recognize or suspect a chronic food intolerance may be inflicting you to feel this fashion ‚Äì and area unit determined to find precisely what those downside foods area unit ‚Äì this sample plan is for you.

The 7-Day Low FODMAP Diet set up for IBS could be a Dietician-made set up that helps you briefly eliminate FODMAPs from your diet, that area unit an established trigger of Irritable viscous Syndrome (IBS).

Before you start this type Low FODMAP diet, you should ask your personal doctor or dietician first. Choose water as your drink (Consume less sugar intake). This app makes identification of high and low FODMAP foods easier to assist you together with your FODMAP friendly diet. this may be useful in reducing symptoms for folks with IBS, Irritable intestine Syndrome, Crohn's disease, Colitis, hereditary disease and numerous alternative food intolerances, food sensitivities, and abdomen issues.

title: Our Journey with Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD)
description:
The Emily Center at Phoenix Children‚Äôs Hospital presents Our Journey with IBD as a tool to help the family of a child diagnosed with IBD identify what they need to know to safely care for their child at home. 

When a child is cared for in the hospital or clinic setting, parents can be overwhelmed by nurses and doctors speaking medical jargon. Sometimes health care providers think they are clearly communicating, but do not check to make sure you understand their instructions. If you are able to teach back the information in your own words, you can be confident you do understand.

The Our Journey with IBD app is designed to:

‚Äî facilitate conversations between families and the health care team.
‚Äî help parents identify what they need to know to safely care for their child at home.
‚Äî give parents a safe way to admit what they do not know or understand and ask questions.
‚Äî cue families on what they need to teach back or demonstrate to their nurse or doctor. This gives the health care provider an opportunity to confirm information and skills and correct misunderstandings.
‚Äî help families feel confident that they can safely care for their child at home, know the signs of possible problems, and know how to respond.

About The Emily Center at Phoenix Children‚Äôs Hospital:

Founded in 1990, the Center is named after Emily Anderson.  Emily fought a rare form of leukemia for four years before losing her battle a few days before her seventh birthday.

Frustrated by the lack of easy to understand information about Emily‚Äôs illness, her parents founded The Emily Center so that families of sick children would always have access to pediatric health information that is accurate, easy to understand, and free of charge to Arizona‚Äôs families. http://www.theemilycenter.org and on Twitter @emilycenter.

The Our Journey with IBD mobile app has been funded by a grant from Cox.

title: Ada ‚Äì your health companion
description:
Ada helps you and your loved ones check symptoms and discover what might be causing them ‚Äì day or night without an appointment. Whatever‚Äôs bothering you, from stomach problems to headache, Ada‚Äôs free symptom checker can help you find answers and let you know if you should see a doctor.

 Join the 10 million people who have already downloaded the world's most popular symptom check.‚Ä® Doctors trained Ada for years, so you can get a prediagnosis within minutes. 


How do free symptom checks work?

You answer simple questions about your own or someone else‚Äôs health and symptoms.
Ada‚Äôs AI assesses your answers against its medical dictionary of thousands of disorders and medical conditions.
You receive a personalized assessment report that tells you what could be wrong and what to do next.


What can you expect from an assessment?

- Data privacy and security ‚Äì we apply the strictest data regulations to protect you and keep your information private.
- Smart results ‚Äì our core system connects medical knowledge with intelligent technology.
- Personalized health information ‚Äì your guidance is personal to your unique health profile. 
- Assessments for loved ones ‚Äì if you assess someone else, their information stays separate from your own. 
- Health checks ‚Äì your assessments include information that may be relevant and helpful to your doctor. 
- 24/7 access ‚Äì you can use the free symptom checker anytime, anywhere.


What can you tell Ada?

Ada answers medical questions of every kind. Here are some of the most common searches:

Symptoms
- Fever
- Allergic rhinitis
- Loss of appetite
- Headache
- Abdominal pain and tenderness 
- Nausea
- Fatigue
- Vomiting
- Dizziness


Medical conditions:
- Common cold 
- Influenza infection (flu)
- Viral sinusitis
- Diabetes
- Tension headache
- Migraine
- Chronic pain
- Fibromyalgia
- Arthritis
- Allergy
- Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS)
- Anxiety disorder
- Depression

Categories:
- Skin conditions such as rashes, acne, insect bites
- Pregnancy 
- Children‚Äôs health
- Sleeping problems
- Indigestion issues, such as vomiting, diarrhea
- Eye infections

Disclaimer
The Ada Health App is a Class I medical device in the European Union. Registration in other markets is pending.

We want to hear from you. If you have any feedback or just want to get in touch, reach us at hello@ada.com

comments: Pretty accurate heading. Again HEADING and not a diagnostic So people won't get it wrong about the app. Extremelly helpful, since the test I've inputed on was an already medical confirmed diagnosis and ADA has provided three oprions which one of them is the one I am on current medical treatment. So, I will definitely use it as a pre-docs visit since it helps to describe symptoms to the physician. First use no ads so far, which is great. Lets see if it stays this way.

I absolutely adore this app, I don't see myself ever getting rid of it. If you're ever unsure of what you have or need a guideline for what you may have, it is the most perfect app. It doesn't make you panic, it explains everything and is so calming when you're worried for the worst. Thank you to the creators! I adore this app and I'm so thankful for it!

This is a really awesome app, I use it every time I feel unwell. And it saved me so many trips to the doctor. The UI looks modern, descriptions of either symptoms or diseases is accurate while also easy to understand. And the best thing? it doesn't have ads, some kind of overpriced subscription or anything like that. this one is my must have.

It is generally a good app, but I put my symptoms in and it focused more on my mild headache and other small things than the actual problem that caused me to try this in the first place which was more important than that head ache, it does this quite a lot but other than this, it's quite good! It is a good way to track symptoms and I haven't seen many ads but it does need to work on the symptom assessment a bit more, but that said, it is hard to make that perfect but it can help.

This app is extremely helpful, I've used it dozens of times since I downloaded. Love that it remembers details about people other than me. It would be cool to have the option to import my medical records .... Not sure if that is something that would be possible to do? Either way, I've love this app, and it never takes long before I feel the need to download it onto a new phone.

title: Low FODMAP diet A to Z
description:
Diet Recipes Low FODMAP
if you are following the Low-FODMAP diet, you will want to avoid all foods high in FODMAPs. They include: fructans, galacto-oligosaccharides, lactose, excess fructose and polyols. If you have already taken hydrogen breath tests and know you can either completely absorb fructose or lactose, you do not have to negate either from your diet, but can as an extra precaution during the elimination phase.

keeps stopping before u even Do Anything.
Keeps crashing

title: Ada ‚Äì your health companion
description:
Ada helps you and your loved ones check symptoms and discover what might be causing them ‚Äì day or night without an appointment. Whatever‚Äôs bothering you, from stomach problems to headache, Ada‚Äôs free symptom checker can help you find answers and let you know if you should see a doctor.

 Join the 10 million people who have already downloaded the world's most popular symptom check.‚Ä® Doctors trained Ada for years, so you can get a prediagnosis within minutes. 


How do free symptom checks work?

You answer simple questions about your own or someone else‚Äôs health and symptoms.
Ada‚Äôs AI assesses your answers against its medical dictionary of thousands of disorders and medical conditions.
You receive a personalized assessment report that tells you what could be wrong and what to do next.


What can you expect from an assessment?

- Data privacy and security ‚Äì we apply the strictest data regulations to protect you and keep your information private.
- Smart results ‚Äì our core system connects medical knowledge with intelligent technology.
- Personalized health information ‚Äì your guidance is personal to your unique health profile. 
- Assessments for loved ones ‚Äì if you assess someone else, their information stays separate from your own. 
- Health checks ‚Äì your assessments include information that may be relevant and helpful to your doctor. 
- 24/7 access ‚Äì you can use the free symptom checker anytime, anywhere.


What can you tell Ada?

Ada answers medical questions of every kind. Here are some of the most common searches:

Symptoms
- Fever
- Allergic rhinitis
- Loss of appetite
- Headache
- Abdominal pain and tenderness 
- Nausea
- Fatigue
- Vomiting
- Dizziness


Medical conditions:
- Common cold 
- Influenza infection (flu)
- Viral sinusitis
- Diabetes
- Tension headache
- Migraine
- Chronic pain
- Fibromyalgia
- Arthritis
- Allergy
- Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS)
- Anxiety disorder
- Depression

Categories:
- Skin conditions such as rashes, acne, insect bites
- Pregnancy 
- Children‚Äôs health
- Sleeping problems
- Indigestion issues, such as vomiting, diarrhea
- Eye infections

Disclaimer
The Ada Health App is a Class I medical device in the European Union. Registration in other markets is pending.

We want to hear from you. If you have any feedback or just want to get in touch, reach us at hello@ada.com

comments: Pretty accurate heading. Again HEADING and not a diagnostic So people won't get it wrong about the app. Extremelly helpful, since the test I've inputed on was an already medical confirmed diagnosis and ADA has provided three oprions which one of them is the one I am on current medical treatment. So, I will definitely use it as a pre-docs visit since it helps to describe symptoms to the physician. First use no ads so far, which is great. Lets see if it stays this way.

I absolutely adore this app, I don't see myself ever getting rid of it. If you're ever unsure of what you have or need a guideline for what you may have, it is the most perfect app. It doesn't make you panic, it explains everything and is so calming when you're worried for the worst. Thank you to the creators! I adore this app and I'm so thankful for it!

This is a really awesome app, I use it every time I feel unwell. And it saved me so many trips to the doctor. The UI looks modern, descriptions of either symptoms or diseases is accurate while also easy to understand. And the best thing? it doesn't have ads, some kind of overpriced subscription or anything like that. this one is my must have.

It is generally a good app, but I put my symptoms in and it focused more on my mild headache and other small things than the actual problem that caused me to try this in the first place which was more important than that head ache, it does this quite a lot but other than this, it's quite good! It is a good way to track symptoms and I haven't seen many ads but it does need to work on the symptom assessment a bit more, but that said, it is hard to make that perfect but it can help.

This app is extremely helpful, I've used it dozens of times since I downloaded. Love that it remembers details about people other than me. It would be cool to have the option to import my medical records .... Not sure if that is something that would be possible to do? Either way, I've love this app, and it never takes long before I feel the need to download it onto a new phone.

title: Low FODMAP diet A to Z
description:
Diet Recipes Low FODMAP
if you are following the Low-FODMAP diet, you will want to avoid all foods high in FODMAPs. They include: fructans, galacto-oligosaccharides, lactose, excess fructose and polyols. If you have already taken hydrogen breath tests and know you can either completely absorb fructose or lactose, you do not have to negate either from your diet, but can as an extra precaution during the elimination phase.
descriptionHTML:
Diet Recipes Low FODMAP
if you are following the Low-FODMAP diet, you will want to avoid all foods high in FODMAPs. They include: fructans, galacto-oligosaccharides, lactose, excess fructose and polyols. If you have already taken hydrogen breath tests and know you can either completely absorb fructose or lactose, you do not have to negate either from your diet, but can as an extra precaution during the elimination phase.
summary: Low FODMAP Diet for IBS: List of Foods to Eat and Avoid

title: Ulcerative Colitis Diet - Pick the Right Food
description:
Ulcerative colitis (UC) is a chronic, inflammatory disease of the colon and rectum. It‚Äôs one of two main inflammatory bowel diseases, the other being Crohn‚Äôs disease.

When a person has UC, sores called ulcers develop inside the colon.

Symptoms of the disease include:

abdominal pain
blood or pus in the stool
diarrhea
nausea
rectal bleeding
fatigue
weight loss

Without proper nutrients, the symptoms of your Crohn‚Äôs disease or ulcerative colitis can cause serious complications, including nutrient deficiencies, weight loss, and malnutrition. 

We have several tips for a healthy diet that‚Äôs well-balanced and nutrient rich. 

Download this app now, and start to feel better.

title: Crohn's Disease
description:
Choose This not That for Crohn‚Äôs Disease. Inside this colorful app, you will find easy to follow suggestions on how to improve your health through nutrition and the food choices you make every day. This app provides comprehensive and actionable nutrition guidelines for how to prevent and cope with pains and symptoms associated with Crohn‚Äôs Disease (CRD). If you rather tackle health issues and risks through proper nutrition and lifestyle changes then this app is for you! Last update: Nov. 2019.

A number of powerful, unique and interactive features make this app so different and superior to others in the market:

‚Ä¢ Is this food good for me? Answers the common question about suitability of various food items for your personal situation. And it does so in an easy to understand and colorful graphic form.

‚Ä¢ Recipes. Most popular recipes on leading web sites.

‚Ä¢ Health issues often come our way in groups of two or more. They are often caused by other health complications or result in other illnesses. In case of CRD, there are numerous symptoms that might accompany it. It is for that reason, that we have included separate guidelines for those who might suffer from any of the following likely conditions or risks along with CRD: anemia (iron deficiency), colon cancer, constipation, diarrhea, excess weight, gallstones, kidney stones, osteoporosis, stress, ulcers and Vitamin D deficiency. Also included are guidelines on autoimmunity including detoxification, anti-inflammation, leaky gut, Microbiome & Specific Carb Diet (SCD).

‚Ä¢ Top-5 items to eat/do, or avoid.

‚Ä¢ Food Suggestions. The best food choices within a food group, based on your personal profile. An extremely valuable tool when at restaurants or when grocery shopping. Also included are suggestions on appropriate life style choices, alternative therapies and herbal remedies.

‚Ä¢ ACTIONABLE information on what is good, what is bad, and what is neutral for your condition(s). We single out specific food items, and give you an ordered list of helpful and harmful foods within each food group. 

The primary sources used by Personal Remedies are US government sources such as USDA (US Department of Agriculture), NIH (National Institute of Health) agencies, leading clinics & universities.

Personal Remedies is the publisher of the largest collection of health and nutrition apps for chronic conditions in the market, based in metro-Boston, home to the top ranking healthcare providers and academic institutions in the world.

This app is updated by our team on an ongoing basis. Updates happen seamlessly, and do NOT require frequent inconvenient downloads.

‚ÄúThis technology was developed using the most current clinical evidence-based information that is available in the US. Behind this technology there is a team of expert clinicians, scientists, endocrinologists, oncologists, and other specialists who are passionate about bridging the gap between expert knowledge and the patient.‚Äú 
Katya Tsaioun, PhD, Nutrition, Tufts University; L.D.N.

 ‚ÄúProper nutrition and other alternative treatments show great promise in preventing and treating many of the illnesses that we deal with every day. I encourage all my patients to follow appropriate nutrition and research other options for themselves. The Choose This Not That series are an excellent step towards improving people‚Äôs knowledge in this area.‚Äù
Shahin Tabatabaei, MD
Mass General Hospital; Harvard Medical School

title: Bearable - Symptoms & Mood tracker
description:
‚úÖ All health tracking in one place

Tired of juggling multiple apps to keep track of your mood, symptoms, sleep, exercise, diet, and medication? We think all of this should be kept in one convenient place so that you and your health professional can get the full picture.

‚úÖ Reclaim control over your well-being

Bearable empowers people to reclaim control over their well-being by making mood and symptom tracking simple, convenient, and accessible to all. Making entries in our health diary is quick and effortless, so you can focus more energy on getting better.  

The app has been shaped by our community of thousands of people with varying chronic health issues.

‚úÖ Gain useful insights with just a few clicks a day

With just a few simple clicks each day our intelligent health diary can help you to gain insights into which daily activities and health factors are positively and negatively affecting your mental and physical health.


Bearable helps you to:

‚úîÔ∏è Record your mood and symptoms in seconds, or go into more detail with an additional note. 
‚úîÔ∏è Fully customise your daily activities and health factors, such as sleep, diet, exercise and medication/supplements. 
‚úîÔ∏è Gain insights into how your daily activities and health factors impact your mood and symptoms using our graphs, calendar and stats pages.
‚úîÔ∏è Keep everything in one place with our neat health timeline, so that you can get the full picture. Use our search function to filter just what you want to see or show your health professional.
‚úîÔ∏è Come prepared to your next doctor or therapist appointment - no need to struggle to remember a detailed health timeline for the last week or month.
‚úîÔ∏è Make journaling a healthy habit with our quick, simple and enjoyable entry process.

And there‚Äôs much more‚Ä¶

‚ûï Set Reminders - Fully customise your reminders, whether it's a general reminder to make a diary entry or a reminder to take your medication and supplements. 
‚ûï Share and Export -  Export data securely to yourself or your health professional
‚ûï Automatic health data sync - You can choose to allow the app to automatically gather data such as Sleep and Steps taken from your phone.
‚ûï Dark mode - Change at night to a display easier on the eyes.
‚ûï Restore data across devices - Restore your data between Apple & Android devices.


üîê PRIVATE & SECURE

Rest easy knowing your data is encrypted securely on our servers. You have full control over your data and can delete it from within the app at any time.  It‚Äôs important to emphasise that we will never under any circumstances sell any personal data to anyone.


üíü MADE BY PEOPLE WHO UNDERSTAND AND CARE

Created by individuals who have lived with mental and physical health issues themselves.  With feedback and feature requests from a research group of thousands of people with a wide variety of chronic diseases and health conditions, including Anxiety, Depression, CFS (ME), MS (Multiple Sclerosis), Fibromyalgia, Endometriosis, Bipolar, BPD, PTSD, Migraines, Headaches, Vertigo, Cancer (Chemo Symptoms), Arthritis, Crohns, Diabetes, IBS and IBD.  Our aim is to make our symptom tracker simple and accessible to everyone, even if suffering from the fatigue and brain fog that often accompanies many conditions.

We have created a real sense of community around Bearable and will continue to listen closely to those who need it most.  We are committed to continue improving upon this app that could help many people start to feel like they can reclaim control over their health.  If you have any questions, feedback or feature requests, please send them over to james@bearable.app.  We‚Äôd love to hear from you.

comments: This is absolutely the best of its kind. I have never seen such a comprehensive, customizable, well-designed app that serves as many functions as this one. I've already shown it to multiple friends/therapists. For those of you moaning about the cost... seriously, getting the subscription will set you back just over $2/month. I work professionally with highly impoverished individuals who do have to count every penny, but come on. Most people can shell out a couple bucks without harm.

The app lets you log your mood, any symptoms you are having, and a number of factors that you think may be affecting your mood/symptoms. The default categories to log are good, but you can add/remove/edit all of the categories to fit you better. It's super easy to fill out, even when I'm not feeling well. It (sometimes) feels like I'm logging meaningless information, but then when I click on the Insights tab, it shows me tons of relevant information about which factors are influencing my mood (or any other symptom I log!). Turns out listening to music and video chats work wonders for my mood--good to know! This is also a wonderful way to record how I'm feeling over time--it lets me easily decipher long-term changes in my wellbeing, which is great information to discuss with medical professionals.

I really like this app, it's easy to use and the design is nice and the ability to customize it to your needs is great. However, the syncing isn't very reliable. I have a phone and a tablet, and downloaded it on both, I tried to log in on the tablet, and only a few entries were visible. Later I went to look at the one on my phone, and half the entries are gone, and so are factors I added. I want to keep using this app, but if it's going to randomly forget things that's a problem.

I have tried multiple times in the past to find a way that I could easily log my moods in a way that felt nuanced and meaningful but also flexible and customizable, but this is the first app I have ever seen that got it right. For once, I am finding it convenient to do quick check ins and even monitor my food and water intake which I never thought I'd have the patience to do. You don't have to get premium, but it's well worth it at least to support a great app.

Brilliant App & well worth paying for. I wanted an app to record daily symptoms to enable me to give an accurate report to my GP. This app has everything I wanted & more. Being able to write notes by each symptom is so helpful & the insight reports are incredible. I did have a little snag when I first signed up for the free trial, but I made contact, explained the situation & James helped me to sort it all out. The app has been fantastic ever since. Thank you bearable team üôèüèªü•∞

title: Ulcerative Colitis Diet
description:
ULCERATIVE COLITIS DIET

Suffering from ulcerative colitis? Don‚Äôt worry about your diet as the ulcerative colitis diet app is going to provide you with the necessary informations required. Follow the ulcerative colitis diet app and rid yourself of the disease. No dieticians required. Get well soon using the ulcerative colitis diet app. 


WHAT IS COLITIS

‚Ä¢	Colitis refers to inflammation of the inner lining of the colon. There are numerous causes of colitis including infection, inflammatory bowel disease , ischemic colitis, allergic reactions, and microscopic colitis.



ULCERATIVE COLITIS SYMPTOMS

Symptoms of colitis depend upon the cause and may include
‚Ä¢	abdominal pain,
‚Ä¢	cramping,
‚Ä¢	diarrhea, with or without blood in the stool (one of the hallmark symptoms of colitis).
‚Ä¢	cramping,
‚Ä¢	bloating, etc.


ULCERATIVE COLITIS DIET

‚Ä¢	dairy
‚Ä¢	grains
‚Ä¢	meats and other proteins
‚Ä¢	fruits
‚Ä¢	vegetables
‚Ä¢	fats and sauces


FOODS TO AVOID WITH COLITIS

‚Ä¢	deli meats
‚Ä¢	dry fruits, berries, figs, prunes, and prune juice
‚Ä¢	raw vegetables not mentioned in the list above
‚Ä¢	spicy sauces, dressings, pickles, and relishes with chunks
‚Ä¢	nuts, seeds, and popcorn
‚Ä¢	foods and beverages that contain caffeine, cocoa, and alcohol



HEALTHY FOODS FOR ULCERATIVE COLITIS DIET

‚Ä¢	Soothe Symptoms With Salmon. Salmon is rich in omega-3 fatty-acids ‚Äî it's good for your heart and your colon. ...
‚Ä¢	Say Yes to Yogurt. ...
‚Ä¢	Savor Some Squash. ...
‚Ä¢	Get Excited About Eggs. ...
‚Ä¢	Dig Into Avocados. ...
‚Ä¢	Go Nuts. ...



DIETS FOR COLITIS SUFFERERS

‚Ä¢	Eat small meals every 3 or 4 hours.
‚Ä¢	Drink at least 8 cups of water per day to avoid dehydration.
‚Ä¢	Eat foods containing added probiotics and prebiotics to encourage better gut health.
‚Ä¢	Limit oils to 8 teaspoons a day.


ULCERATIVE COLITIS DIET RECIPES

1. Turkey tacos 
 2. Asian bowl 
 3. Salmon and veggies 
 4. Couscous salad 
 5. Angel hair pasta with shrimp


COLITIS DIET MENU

‚Ä¢	Meat, fish, or poultry
‚Ä¢	Dairy products (if you're not lactose intolerant)
‚Ä¢	Breads and cereals
‚Ä¢	Fruits and veggies
‚Ä¢	Healthy fats like olive and canola oils

FOODS THAT IRRITATE COLITIS

‚Ä¢	Alcohol.
‚Ä¢	Caffeine.
‚Ä¢	Carbonated drinks.
‚Ä¢	Dairy products, if you're lactose intolerant.
‚Ä¢	Dried beans, peas, and legumes.
‚Ä¢	Dried fruits.

descriptionHTML:
ULCERATIVE COLITIS DIET

Suffering from ulcerative colitis? Don‚Äôt worry about your diet as the ulcerative colitis diet app is going to provide you with the necessary informations required. Follow the ulcerative colitis diet app and rid yourself of the disease. No dieticians required. Get well soon using the ulcerative colitis diet app.


WHAT IS COLITIS

‚Ä¢ Colitis refers to inflammation of the inner lining of the colon. There are numerous causes of colitis including infection, inflammatory bowel disease , ischemic colitis, allergic reactions, and microscopic colitis.



ULCERATIVE COLITIS SYMPTOMS

Symptoms of colitis depend upon the cause and may include
‚Ä¢ abdominal pain,
‚Ä¢ cramping,
‚Ä¢ diarrhea, with or without blood in the stool (one of the hallmark symptoms of colitis).
‚Ä¢ cramping,
‚Ä¢ bloating, etc.


ULCERATIVE COLITIS DIET

‚Ä¢ dairy

‚Ä¢ meats and other proteins
‚Ä¢ fruits
‚Ä¢ vegetables
‚Ä¢ fats and sauces


FOODS TO AVOID WITH COLITIS

‚Ä¢ deli meats
‚Ä¢ dry fruits, berries, figs, prunes, and prune juice
‚Ä¢ raw vegetables not mentioned in the list above
‚Ä¢ spicy sauces, dressings, pickles, and relishes with chunks
‚Ä¢ nuts, seeds, and popcorn
‚Ä¢ foods and beverages that contain caffeine, cocoa, and alcohol



HEALTHY FOODS FOR ULCERATIVE COLITIS DIET

‚Ä¢ Get Excited About Eggs. ...
‚Ä¢ Dig Into Avocados. ...
‚Ä¢ Go Nuts. ...



DIETS FOR COLITIS SUFFERERS

‚Ä¢ Eat small meals every 3 or 4 hours.
‚Ä¢ Drink at least 8 cups of water per day to avoid dehydration.
‚Ä¢ Eat foods containing added probiotics and prebiotics to encourage better gut health.
‚Ä¢ Limit oils to 8 teaspoons a day.


ULCERATIVE COLITIS DIET RECIPES

1. Turkey tacos

3. Salmon and veggies
4. Couscous salad

COLITIS DIET MENU

FOODS THAT IRRITATE COLITIS

title: Food and Symptoms Diary LITE
description:
This mobile food and symptoms diary enables you to narrow down food intolerances such as lactose, histamine or sorbitol intolerance, fructose malabsorption or food allergies. It can also be used to determine your personal threshold (tolerance level) for different foods once a diagnosis has been made. 
The app contains neither advertisements nor any hidden costs such as in-app purchases.
-----
What does "Lite version" mean?
-----
This version is free, there is also a paid PRO version. In the LITE version, you cannot generate a PDF, log your bowel movement, set a reminder, or import data.
If you like this diary app, you can later buy the PRO version and then export your diary entries from the LITE version and import it into the PRO version.
------
Why use this app?
-----
If you believe that you may be suffering from some form of food intolerance or food allergy it is essential to keep a food and symptoms diary for about 2 weeks. With the help of such a food and journal, the medical professional you are consulting can narrow down the reasons for your symptoms. This means they can focus on the right follow-up (eg. H2 breath test) and thus reach an accurate diagnosis.

The app can also be used after diagnosis. Different foods need to be tested to establish a person‚Äôs individual tolerance level, e.g. fructose or FODMAP levels. Therefore, keeping a food and symptoms diary makes sense. 

The app is simple and intuitive. You can record your daily meals by entering them into the journal or simply taking a photo. You can also track your bowel movement (PRO Version only) or note your symptoms as well as the degree of severity and produce a clearly readable PDF (PRO Version only) which you can take to your doctor‚Äôs appointment. Symptoms can also be recorded by taking a photo, which is especially useful when you have symptoms such as rashes or other skin changes.

Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD)
The app can also be used for recording the symptoms of inflammatory bowel diseases such as Crohn‚Äôs disease. 

Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS)
Also patients who follow a FODMAP diet due to IBS may use this app to track their nutrition and symptoms.

-----
Questions or comments?
-----
This app has its own support forum at www.food-intolerance-network.com. If you do find any bugs please drop us a line on the website so we can fix them as fast as possible. Thank you!
----
The symptoms diary app needs the following permissions:
----
+ Photos/Media/Files, Camera: You can, for example, take a picture of your meals or ingredients lists; The files are stored on your device (SD card); The data you enter will also be stored on your device.
+ Identity, Contacts: the app will access your ‚Äúme‚Äù contact information in order to copy your email address, name and date of birth (if you have entered this information into your device) in order to personalize the diary for your doctor. These settings can be changed at any time. The app will NOT read or access any other details in your contacts and will not send any such data back to us.
+ Other: With this app you can create and send a PDF file using the network connection of your phone. There are additional reading materials (e.g. Help & Support) which can only be accessed via the internet. The license authentication is also acquired via the internet. The notifications need the phone to prevent from sleeping and run at startup.

title: Food Intolerances
description:
The app Food Intolerances is a tool to help everyone who has to stick to a restricted diet because of food intolerances or allergies. Typical application cases are: histamine intolerance, mastocytosis, fructose malabsorption, sorbitol intolerance, aspirin intolerance, gluten sensitivity, lactose intolerance or a diet low in FODMAPs.

Latest awards*:
Healthline ‚Äì Best Nutrition Apps 2019
MeinAllergiePortal ‚Äì Digital Health Heroes Award 2018
iMore ‚Äì Best Food Nutrition Apps 2017

It contains more than 1000 foods that are commented and rated in view of the following subjects: 


CARBOHYDRATE MALABSORPTION 
‚ñ™ Fructose
‚ñ™ Lactose
‚ñ™ Sorbitol and other sugar alcohols
‚ñ™ Oligosaccharides (e.g. fructans and galactans)
‚ñ™ FODMAPs (total)
‚ñ™ Sucrose


HISTAMINE INTOLERANCE
‚ñ™ Histamine content
‚ñ™ Tyramine content 
‚ñ™ Histamine liberators and DAO inhibitors 
‚ñ™ Problematic medicines
‚ñ™ Food additives 


SALICYLATE INTOLERANCE
‚ñ™ Salicylate content 
‚ñ™ Problematic food additives


NICKEL ALLERGY
‚ñ™ Nickel content


OTHER SENSITIVITIES AND ALLERGIES
Filters for gluten, wheat, soy, yeast, sulfites, dairy, egg, fish, meat, pork, beef and honey


MORE FEATURES 
‚ñ™ Detailed articles about food intolerances
‚ñ™ Possibility to write notes and manually adjust the rating
‚ñ™ Blog
‚ñ™ Direct link to Wikipedia articles
‚ñ™ No internet connection required


* https://www.baliza.de/en/blog/files/tag-awards.html
  https://www.baliza.de/blog/files/tag-auszeichnung.html

** This app doesn‚Äôt rate brand specific products, but common foods and basic food categories. It provides you with all the information needed to deal with your intolerance and to avoid common mistakes.

+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ 

The app does not replace medical care and must not be used for diagnostic purposes. While the information provided here has been compiled to the best knowledge of the author, mistakes happen, since this is a complex matter which depends closely on the individual person. We are constantly working to improve the app, but information may be wrong and may even contain harmful recommendations.

The Baliza GmbH disclaims any liability as a developer of this app for the accuracy, completeness and timeliness of the information and any resulting damages, consequential damages and other disadvantages. The assertion of claims of any kind is excluded. Some jurisdictions do not allow the limitation of liability for personal injury, or of incidental or consequential damages, so this limitation may not apply to you.

recentChanges:
‚Ä¢ We added a new profile for nickel allergy.
‚Ä¢ All values are now displayed per portion.
‚Ä¢ We added the amount of excess fructose for each food.
‚Ä¢ We added more foods and revised some commentaries.
‚Ä¢ We revised several articles in the info section.
‚Ä¢ We added a link to our blog and to our privacy policy.

We hope you like the changes and would be very happy if you let us and other users know what you like about our app!
comments: It's a good start for me and worth the purchase. Surprising number of foods are missing. Looking forward to regular updates. The extra clinical info in the notes on many foods are very helpful.

I really liked this app until I had a salicylate reaction after I bought cranberry juice because they have it listed as green for salicylates, but it's actually Very High Salicylate. The wikipedia link they provided had no mention of the salicylate content of cranberries. It wasn't until I searched it further on reliable allergy sites that I came across it repeatedly marked as VHS. Very disappointed.

The app you've always needed!!! Let's you add multiple intolerances and visually colors them to help you see what you can and can't eat. Easy to update tolerances for multiple people. So simple love it!

Would be nice to filter only green/yellow+green categories and maybe save that filter. It would help to find out which type of foods aren't working for me and causing me issues. I think it's histamines but not sure yet.

I'm glad I decided to spend a little bit of money to buy this app. The food database is very big, the filter options work great and the info is solid. The only places where I saw inconsistencies with other sources are actually current subjects of debate in the scientific community so it seems like the creators did a very good job compiling the info. The only slight beef I have with the app is that it's not very appealing to the eye but the simplicity of the UI is great!

title: The Low-FODMAP's Diet Plan
description:
FODMAP stands for Fermentable Oligosaccharides, Disaccharides, Monosaccharides, and Polyols, which are short chain carbohydrates and sugar alcohols that are poorly absorbed by the body, resulting in abdominal pain and bloating.
FODMAPs occur in some foods naturally or as additives.
If you eat a lot of these foods you may have symptoms and signs like:
*Gas
*Pain
*Bloating
*Abdominal distention
*Abdominal pain
*Diarrhea
This diet cuts out many common foods that may contain high FODMAP foods. They are eliminated or severely limited for 3-8 weeks, then gradually reintroduced into a low-FODMAP diet to see if they cause symptoms (elimination diet). It is not meant to be a permanent solution because it is very restrictive, but it may work well enough to be a treatment for people with gastrointestinal (GI) problems.
This type of dietary meal plan often is used to help with digestive symptoms from many different conditions, including, irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), small intestinal bacterial overgrowth (SIBO), and other functional GI disorders.

Apps Features:
- About
- What is
- How To Start
- Food to eat and avoid
- Meal Plan Menu (Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner)
- BMI Calculator (Underweight, Normal & Overweight)
- Calories Calculators ( Link to Calculator Website)
- Macro Calculator ( Link to Calculator Website)
- Apps info (Privacy Policy/Disclaimers/More)

Feedback:-
If you have any suggested features or improvement, please leave a comment. In case something is not working correctly please let me know. When posting low rating please describe what is wrong to give the possibility to fix that issue.

In particular, a diet low in fermentable carbs known as FODMAPS is clinically recommended for the management of irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).

Before you start this type Low FODMAP diet, you should ask your personal doctor or dietician first. Choose water as your drink (Consume less sugar intake). This meal plan is high restrictive and temporary. It is not appropriate for certain medical conditions. Prepare all foods yourself at home where possible. Keep a food diary.

This app makes identification of high and low FODMAP foods easier to assist you together with your FODMAP friendly diet. this may be useful in reducing symptoms for folks with IBS, Irritable intestine Syndrome, Crohn's disease, Colitis, hereditary disease and numerous alternative food intolerances, food sensitivities, and abdomen issues.

It‚Äôs designed to provide you some concepts and take the strain and estimation out of your meal-planning.

Remember that an occasional FODMAP diet ought to be strictly followed for a minimum of twenty eight days (4 weeks) in order to be effective

title: Poocount Lite - Toilet Journal
description:
Poocount is an app that keeps track of your bowel movements. You can easily add new entries and see a chart of all your bowel movements over time. (All the data stays on your device so you keep control over them)
We hope the app will be useful for you.

Why a Poocount app? (guess we have to answer this question :-)
An increasing number of people has Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD, Crohn/Ulcerative colitis or Colitis ulcerosa). There are lots of indicators of the severity of the illness, one of them being the amount of time you spend on the toilet. From time to time I ask myself if I am better now than, say 3 months ago. Usually my brain blocks here because it‚Äôs rather hard to remember the state of being some months ago. 
That's when I decided to develop a small app that can help me with this problem. For the time this is rather a weekend project, but hopefully it will be useful for you. I hope you don't mind when it takes some days to respond to questions.

comments: It's pretty bare compared to the paid version, almost by too much. You can only track the date, time, whether you pooped (not even how it looked or felt) and whether there was blood, and that's it. I don't think you can track constipation either, just diarrhea. I also found a glitch where you can't just delete an entry, you also have to exit and reenter the app to make it disappear.
5 stars right off the top. It may change after i open and use it, However I am rating this app developer 5 stars for Effort, and willingness to improve. TY
This app is so very helpful, especially for us j-pouchers. Thanks and I hope more IBD people become aware of how useful it is
It won't let me download it. I have tried multiple times, and restarted my device many times. I will change my review, when I can actually use it.

title: Low FODMAP Diet Recipes
description:
Diet Recipes Low FODMAP
if you are following the Low-FODMAP diet, you will want to avoid all foods high in FODMAPs. They include: fructans, galacto-oligosaccharides, lactose, excess fructose and polyols. If you have already taken hydrogen breath tests and know you can either completely absorb fructose or lactose, you do not have to negate either from your diet, but can as an extra precaution during the elimination phase.

title: Low - FODMAP Diet
description:
Super-simple utility to help you quickly find what foods are suggested for a Low-FODMAP diet.  Helps sufferers of Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS), Fructose Malabsorption, and other digestive or gastrointestinal issues.

Filters instantly while you type!

Life is too short to waste time suffering because of your food... use this app to quickly determine whether a food is likely to cause you problems.

Just glance down to see one of three icons for "good", "bad", or "unsure" (meaning that different sources disagree about the effects of that particular food).

This free app contains a list that was created from several sources (listed in the About tab of the app) to create a master list of about 250 foods.

Disclaimer: this app is not made by a doctor and it does not attempt to diagnose or treat anything. It is simply a helpful tool to assist people trying to adhere to a low FODMAP diet.

recentChanges: v1.1 - Currently 247 foods listed.  Currently has English and Finnish languages. Please contact me if you'd like to volunteer to translate.
comments: Some of the foods listed are not ok according to other sources (eg: Monash Uni). Some are also fine in small amounts. Having some sort of scale as well as out-right good/bad would therefore be useful. Would also be useful to show which lists a food is listed on, maybe also making those links clickable to open a browser window.
An excellent little list. On my htc one it crashes every other time I open it (blank screen) meaning I have to force quit the app via settings to get it working again.
Was really good and simple. But now it just loads up with a massive empty search box, which doesn't respond to anything at all.... Go back to the list version
This is a cut-down version of the Simple FODMAP app, which is more complete than this one. Lots of allowed foods are missing, which isn't good.

Needs to be more comprehensive.  No entries for "peanuts", "almonds", "spelt", "sorgum", etc. Adding the reasons...along with a reference, if questionable...explaining why certain foods need to be avoided would be very helpful.

title: FODMAPs diet for IBS/SIBO
description:
About FODMAPs :

FODMAPs are short chain carbohydrates that are difficult to digest in the small intestine. They include Fructose, Lactose, Polyols and Oligos.

Most people can tolerate FODMAPs. But for some people, especially people with IBS or SIBO, they cannot tolerate one or more kinds of FODMAPs.

FODMAPs are found in vegetables and fruits at different levels and mostly in processed food.

App Overview :

On the main page and also in the menu, you will find the vegetable and fruit sections which include the FODMAPs levels for a regular portion of each type of FODMAPs. The green light means that for this type of FODMAPs for a regular portion, consumption should be tolerated. A red light means that the level is too high for an intolerant person.

Eating regular portions of fruits and vegetables with only green lights should be well tolerated for everyone. However, if there are one or more red lights, people need to be careful. With time and testing, it is possible to better understand our tolerance for each type of FODMAPs.

You will also find indications and recommendations for other types of food.

title: Foodzilla! Nutrition Assistant, Food Diary, Recipe
description:
See nutrients, calories, vitamins and minerals by just taking pictures of your meals. Discover new healthy recipes and use filters to find the ones that fit your diet such as "Low Carb", "High Protein", "High Fat", "Low FODMAP" and more. 
No In-App Purchases. No Ads. No email required.

TRACKING FOOD IS FAST AND EASY

‚Ä¢ Track Nutrition ‚Äî Count calories and macros by just taking pictures of your meals.
‚Ä¢ Track Food Groups ‚Äî Understand the variety of foods in your diet and the serving amounts. Food is categorised into these groups: "Dairy", "Bread (Starch)", "Fruit", "Vegetable", "Meat".
‚Ä¢ Find Recipes ‚Äî Discover healthy recipes for the ingredients you have with cooking instructions and nutrition already calculated.
‚Ä¢ Recipe Filters ‚Äî Filter recipes by diet labels such as "Low Carb", "High Fat", "High Protein", by cuisine "Korean, Japanese, German, Indian", by allergens "Dairy-Free", "Low FODMAP", "Vegan", "Vegetarian", "Pescatarian" and others
‚Ä¢ Quick Logging ‚Äî Easily log items that you know the calories for or manually by adding ingredients.
‚Ä¢ Track All Nutrients ‚Äî saturated fat, trans fat, mono fat, protein, carbs, sugar, fiber, cholesterol, added sugar, iron, magnesium, sodium, vitamins, and minerals.
‚Ä¢ Track Water ‚Äî Log water intake in ml
‚Ä¢ Food Diary ‚Äî Catalogs previous meals and sorts them based on calories
‚Ä¢ Save Recipes ‚Äî Catalogs your favourite recipes in one place
‚Ä¢ Sync Food ‚Äî Sync the food and nutrition intake with other apps such Fitbit

LOG YOUR EXERCISE AND STEPS

‚Ä¢ Automatic activity tracking ‚Äî Sync calories burned and exercise data with other apps like Fitbit, Polar, Garmin & Strava.
‚Ä¢ Choose from 100+ exercises.
‚Ä¢ Log Cardio Exercises ‚Äî Including running, walking, biking, boxing, cycling, swimming, yoga, pilates and more.
‚Ä¢ Log Strength Exercises ‚Äî Including sets, reps, and weight per set.
‚Ä¢ Track Steps ‚Äî Set a daily step goal and sync steps from Fitbit.

NUTRITION SUPERPOWERS IN YOUR POCKET

‚Ä¢ Share data ‚Äî Share your data with your nutritionist, dietician & personal trainer.
‚Ä¢ Insights ‚Äî learn about the nutrient distribution of your diet, about the food you eat, ingredients you eat often, vitamins distribution, and missing minerals.
‚Ä¢ Progress charts ‚Äî Beautiful daily and weekly charts to track your nutrition & stay healthy.
‚Ä¢ Food composition databases ‚Äî Access food composition databases from New Zealand, Australia, and the United Kingdom.

CUSTOMISE YOUR GOALS

‚Ä¢ Choose your goals ‚Äî Set multiple goals such as weight loss, weight gain, strength gain, understanding food, feel young and more.
‚Ä¢ Macronutrient goals ‚Äî Set daily goals for tracking macronutrient intakes like fat, carbohydrates, protein, and fiber.
‚Ä¢ Energy goals ‚Äî Set daily goals for calories intake and calories burned.
‚Ä¢ Body goals ‚Äî Set body weight and fat percentage goals.
‚Ä¢ Food groups goals ‚Äî Set serving goals for each food group such as "Diary", "Bread (Starch)", "Fruit", "Vegetable", "Meat" 

Notes:

- Calories estimated may have a margin of error of minus/plus 100 calories.
- Nutritional information is a best-effort estimate and the actual meal may contain more ingredients that are not possible to detect using machine learning such as oil.
- The information in Foodzilla is not intended to replace the advice of your GP, a one on one relationship with a qualified health care professional and is not intended as medical advice. It is not intended for self-diagnosis, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.
--------

title: Low FODMAP Diet - The D.I.Y Beginner's Guide
description:
Do you often experience digestive stress after eating certain foods?
Can the discomfort be so severe that it affects your day-to-day activities?
The link between foods and digestive disorders is well recognised, and there is a good chance that FODMAPs ‚Äì small carbohydrates in certain foods ‚Äì are the culprit.

As a food intolerance dietitian, I‚Äôve seen how remarkable a low-FODMAP diet can be for people with chronic gastrointestinal symptoms‚Ä¶ things like recurrent bloating, gas, cramps, diarrhea or constipation. This diet is one of the natural ways known to alleviate such chronic symptoms.

There‚Äôs also many new case studies suggesting it can help with several other chronic health conditions too.

If you‚Äôre keen to learn more, and maybe even try a low FODMAP diet for yourself, this  beginner‚Äôs guide is a great place to start.

title: FODMAP Friendly
description:
***OVER 50 PREVIOUSLY UNTESTED FOODS INCLUDED***
***SPECIFIC FODMAP LEVELS DISPLAYED FOR MOST FOODS***

The FODMAP Friendly Food Program incorporates the FODMAP Friendly logo. FODMAP Friendly is the only registered Certification Trademark worldwide certifying FODMAP levels in food.
The logo was designed to enable consumers with symptoms of Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) who are following a Low FODMAP diet to easily identify and select suitable packaged food products.
Along with testing specific products for their FODMAP levels, we have also hundreds of fresh foods, as well. The FODMAP Friendly App, displays this information straight from our accredited laboratories in a user friendly food database. 

FEATURES: 
- View the FODMAP content of hundreds of various foods including over 50 previously UNTESTED foods. 

- View specific FODMAP levels for foods, so as to better cater to personal thresholds. 

- View each food‚Äôs overall PASS/FAIL rating according to the FODMAP Friendly Certified levels. 

- View the range of FODMAP Friendly approved products, with product information and availability information. 

- Use our database to find a FODMAP dietitian near you!

- Use our database to find a FODMAP dietitian near you!

title: Low FODMAP Diet
description:
FODMAP stands for‚Ä¶deep breath‚Ä¶Fermentable Oligosaccharides, Disaccharides, Monosaccharides, and Polyols.

And that‚Äôs science talk for a type of carbohydrate that‚Äôs hard to digest and found mainly in plant-based foods, dairy products, and sweeteners.

But just for the sake of thoroughness, let‚Äôs unpack this acronym one word at a time.

It starts with fermentable because these carbs ferment easily in the colon.

Then come three types of saccharides, which are sugar molecules found in foods.

Monosaccharides are often called simple sugars because they have a very simple structure. Mono means one and saccharide means sugar. So, one sugar.

The monosaccharides are‚Ä¶

# Glucose
Glucose is a type of sugar also known as blood sugar, which is found in our blood and produced from the food we eat (most dietary carbohydrates contain glucose, either as the sole form of sugar or combined with the other two simple sugars given above).

When people talk about ‚Äúblood sugar levels,‚Äù they‚Äôre talking about the amount of glucose floating around in the blood.

# Fructose
Fructose is a type of sugar naturally found in fruit, and also found in processed products like sucrose (table sugar) and high-fructose corn syrup, both of which are about 50% fructose and 50% glucose.

Fructose is converted into glucose by the liver and then released into the blood for use.

# Galactose
Galactose is a type of sugar found in dairy products and it‚Äôs metabolized similarly to fructose.

Oligosaccharides are molecules that contain several monosaccharides linked together in chain-like structures. Oligos is Greek for a few, so a ‚Äúfew‚Äù sugars.

These sugars are one of the components of fiber found in plants, which our bodies are able to partially break down into glucose (leaving the fibrous, indigestible parts behind to do good things in our guts).

Many vegetables also contain fructo-oligosaccharides, which are short chains of fructose molecules. These are metabolized accordingly (the ‚Äúchains‚Äù are broken and the individual fructose molecules are then converted into glucose for use).

Another common form of oligosaccharide that we eat is raffinose, which is comprised of a chain of galactose, glucose, and fructose (called a trisaccharide), and which can be found in beans, cabbage, brussels sprouts, broccoli,asparagus, other vegetables, and whole grains.

Galactooligosaccharides round out the list of oligosaccharides, and are short chains of galactose molecules. These are indigestible but play a role in stimulating healthy bacteria growth in the gut.

Disaccharides are molecules that‚Äôs composed of two monosaccarides .

Two common examples of disaccharides are milk sugar (lactose), which is made from glucose and galactose, and table sugar (sucrose), which is made from glucose and fructose.

Last but not least is the polyols, which are also called sugar alcohols, and which are a group of low-calorie, sweet carbs that can be substituted for table sugar.

More feature;

Finally we wish you a great success on your diet journey!

Download for free now! Thank you.

title: Low FODMAP Diet Recipes
description:
Low FODMAP Diet Recipes

FODMAP is an acronym, derived from "Fermentable Oligo-, Di-, Mono-saccharides And Polyols".They are short chain carbohydrates that are poorly absorbed in the small intestine. They include short chain oligo-saccharide polymers of fructose (fructans) and galactooligosaccharides (GOS, stachyose, raffinose), disaccharides (lactose), monosaccharides (fructose), and sugar alcohols (polyols), such as sorbitol, mannitol, xylitol, and maltitol. Most FODMAPs are naturally present in food and the human diet, but the polyols may be added artificially in commercially-prepared foods and beverages.

Most FODMAPs are naturally present in food and the human diet, but the polyols may be added artificially in commercially-prepared foods and beverages.

title: Crohn's Assistant
description:
I made this android phone application because I've been suffering from Crohn's disease since 2010. I utilized my personal experience about the disease and developed the content of the application to serve my needs. I hope that it will help some of you, because it helped me manage my illness.

In the app:

- You can store and analyze your blood tests. You can attach images(using the camera of the phone) about your blood tests. Mark some important value as favorite and query for them.
- Store multiple symptoms on the same day. Rate them from 1 to 5 and analyze the symptom graph.
- Store multiple meal on a day
- Store your medicines ( dosage, frequency, type, opening date). The program tries to estimate, when your medicine will be empty.
- Store your examinations (multiple examination can be stored for one day). You can query the last examinations by type.
- You can export the symptoms and meal to CSV file and you can send it to your doctor
- You can store information about stool


You can download the application from the google play store.

More about the app: http://www.lebersoftware.hu/crohn_assistant
